intro: Salicornia fruticosa var. doeringii, commonly known as sea beans or glassworts, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae, characterized by its succulent, salt-tolerant stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline habitats. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually green or reddish and appear in clusters. It plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
